meanings.definition: Affected by or associated with nausea or vomiting.
meanings.sent1: The bilious child felt sick after the bumpy car ride.
meanings.sent2: She turned bilious after eating the spoiled food.
meanings.sent3: The bilious man couldn't stomach the sight of the fish market.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage made her feel bilious.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride left him feeling bilious and queasy.

meanings.sent1: The bilious old cat hissed at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent2: His bilious mood made it hard for others to approach him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bilious nature, he still had a few friends who understood him.
meanings.sent4: Her bilious attitude towards work made her unpopular among colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The bilious customer complained about everything in the restaurant.

meanings.sent1: The bilious neighbor always found something to grumble about.
meanings.sent2: She had a bilious personality that clashed with her cheerful coworkers.
meanings.sent3: Even on sunny days, his bilious outlook on life remained unchanged.
meanings.sent4: Her bilious comments often dampened the mood at family gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The bilious teacher scolded the students for the smallest mistakes.
